0.title: Adult Dosing
0.mono:
• Dandruff: (shampoo) apply TOPICALLY to hair and scalp, rinse, repeat, leave on 5 minutes, rinse again; use twice weekly for 2 weeks then once weekly or as needed
  • Psoriasis: (cream) apply TOPICALLY to affected areas 1-4 times daily; (shampoo) apply TOPICALLY to hair and scalp, rinse, repeat, leave on 5 minutes, rinse again; use twice weekly for 2 weeks then once weekly or as needed
  • Seborrheic dermatitis: (cream) apply TOPICALLY to affected areas 1-4 times daily; (shampoo) apply TOPICALLY to hair and scalp, rinse, repeat, leave on 5 minutes, rinse again; use twice weekly for 2 weeks then once weekly or as needed

sub.title: Contraindications
sub.mono:
• absence of beneficial use when used previously
  • active or inflamed psoriasis, weeping eczema, erythrodermic and generalized pustular psoriasis
  • hypersensitivity to coal toar
  • photosensitivity
  • presence of folliculitis or acne vulgaris

sub.title: Precautions
sub.mono:
• avoid contact with eyes
  • avoid exposure to sunlight for at least 24 hours
  • coal tars are generally considered safe, but messy and unpleasant
  • do not apply coal tar preparation (other than bath emulsions) to genital or rectal areas
  • do not apply to acutely inflamed skin

sub.title: Pregnancy Category
sub.mono: Fetal risk cannot be ruled out. (TH)

sub.title: Breast Feeding
sub.mono:
• WHO: Compatible with breastfeeding.
  • Micromedex: Infant risk is minimal.

0.title: US Trade Names
0.mono:
• Neutrogena T/Gel
  • Neutrogena T/Derm
  • Betatar Gel
  • Cutar Emulsion
  • DHS Tar
  • Denorex
  • Doak Tar
  • Duplex T

7.title: Mechanism Of Action
7.mono: Topical: Coal tar suppresses the hyperplastic skin in some proliferative disorders. Although there is no confirmed evidence as to its pharmacologic effects, its actions in humans have been reported as antiseptic, antipruritic, antiparasitic, antifungal, antibacterial, keratoplastic, and antiacantholic. Vasoconstrictive activity has also been reported.

9.title: Administration
9.mono:
Topical
  • (shampoo) massage well into wet scalp for 3 to 5 minutes and rinse, repeat, and rinse
  • (oil) pour 1 to 3 capfuls into warm bath water or after shower, apply directly onto wet skin
  • avoid sun exposure for at least 24 hours after application
  • avoid contact with eyes; do not apply in or around the rectum, in the genital area or groin, or with any other form of psoriasis therapy, unless directed by physician

  • X-Seb T Plus Conditioning Shampoo
    Topical Shampoo: 10 %

13.title: Clinical Teaching
13.mono:
• Tell patient to avoid sun exposure for at least 24 h after application.
  • Patient should avoid drug contact with eyes, peri-rectal area, genital area, groin, or acutely inflamed skin, unless otherwise directed by healthcare professional.
  • Advise patient to avoid coal tar contact with any other psoriasis topical treatment, unless otherwise directed by healthcare professional.
  • Tell patient to not use cosmetics or other skin care products on the treated skin areas.
